docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals said they were getting ready for an influx of newly insured patients, but many health care providers said the pace was slower than usual because of the New Year’s holiday.

headline.main: Consumers Start Using Coverage Under Health Law
headline.print_headline: Consumers Start Using Coverage Under Health Law

docs.abstract: Consumers across the United States begin using coverage provided by the new health care law; many provisions of the law offering new benefits and protections to consumers also take effect.
docs.snippet: Hospitals said they were getting ready for an influx of newly insured patients, but many health care providers said the pace was slower than usual because of the New Year’s holiday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Sonia Sotomayor’s injunction against the part of the health care law related to coverage for birth control broadened the avenues for opponents.

headline.main: Health Law Challenge Opens Up New Front
headline.print_headline: Health Law Challenge Opens Up New Front

docs.abstract: News analysis; Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor opens a second front in legal challenges to the health care reform law by temporarily blocking enforcement of birth control coverage requirement for employer health care plans; temporary injunction was granted to the Little Sisters of the Poor, an order of Colorado nuns, and related groups.

docs.lead_paragraph: The so-called "young invincibles" are so important to the success of the Affordable Care Act that supporters and detractors are spending millions to reach them with racy ads, social media campaigns and celebrity endorsements. The president is even (gasp) asking their mothers to help convince them to sign up for insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Greece assumes the presidency of the European Union Wednesday, starting 2014 with a promise by the government to pull the country out of a six-year recession, keep a balanced budget, and effectively end a financial crisis that rattled the euro.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has thrown a hitch into President Barack Obama's new health care law by blocking a requirement that some religion-affiliated organizations provide health insurance that includes birth control.

headline.main: Justice Delays Health Law's Birth Control Mandate
headline.print_headline: Justice Delays Health Law's Birth Control Mandate

docs.lead_paragraph: This could be the year that things finally turn around for President Barack Obama's health care law. Yet it could start with another round of glitches that vex consumers and leave Republicans crowing, "We told you so."
